title: Seagrid App
content:
An app connected to a boat alarm for boat clubs. I have worked with both the frontend in React Native, where I followed design guidelines from Figma and adapted solutions according to the designer's wishes.

I have also worked with the backend in NestJS where the logic and functionality for the app is handled.

Since the app is connected to the alarm's hardware, I have also had the opportunity to learn how the integration between software and device works.

title: Holidaze
content: This project is a venue booking platform built with Next.js, integrating with the Noroff API for venue data and booking functionality. It utilizes several modern technologies to provide a rich and interactive user experience, including OpenAI via the Vercel AI SDK, Google Maps API, Shadcn UI for components, and Framer Motion for animations.

title: Swedish Wellness App

images.alt: image of a wellness mobile app

content:
A wellness app for both businesses and individuals where I work on frontend development using React Native, following design guidelines and implementing solutions based on the designer’s requirements.

In this project, I have primarily focused on optimizing components and adding functionality that enhances the user experience.

title: Aucsome
content:
Aucsome is a platform where users can bid on items, list their own items for auction, and analyze bidding patterns through visual insights.

It was built using Next.js and integrates Recharts for data visualization, ShadCN for UI components, Framer Motion for animations, and the Noroff API for backend functionality.

title: MAI
content:
This project was part of a workshop in Skövde, Sweden, where we gave a talk on the current state of AI—where it was yesterday, where it is today, and answered audience questions on the topic.

My role in this was to build a web application where we integrated AI functionality using AWS Face & Label Rekognition, OpenAI's object generator, and text generator via the Vercel AI SDK.

This was used as part of an AI seminar, allowing attendees to test and interact with the AI-powered features hands-on.
